channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A very large branch has broken of an ash tree and is laid across the Prow. It is only supported or stopped from crashing further down by two upright branches as shown in the photos. It is therefore not stable and the tree shows further signs of possible damage likely to lead to further branches falling down. This is potentially very dangerous, 26th June
item.description:
It is located on a Prow on Churchdown Hill. The 5 figure grid reference is 88120 18720

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stump Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous junction across cycle lane, 26th June
item.description:
The junction turning into Staverton Bridge from the B4063 is dangerous for cyclist as motorist often turn blindly into the park home area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Yellow and white lines no longer visible, 26th June
item.description:
Over the past few years both the white and yellow lines have faded so it’s not clear where you can and can’t park. Please could they be reinstated along the whole length of Andover Walk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Andover Walk, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
